programme.title: Hatari!
programme.desc: African-set adventure starring John Wayne as an animal hunter who encounters all kinds of obstacles in his quest to procure wildlife specimens for zoos. (1962)(150 mins).

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: Four boys take a trip to find a dead body said to be hidden in the nearby woods. Strong language/violence/sexual references/flashing images. (1986)(86 mins).

programme.title: Paper Moon
programme.desc: When conman Ryan O'Neal is lumbered with an orphaned girl, she soon decides to join the swindle. 10-year-old Tatum O'Neal stars in an Oscar-winning role. (1973)(102mins).

programme.title: My Fair Lady
programme.desc: The multi-Oscar-winning classic musical about a pompous phonetics professor who tries to transform Cockney flower girl Audrey Hepburn into a member of high society. (1964)(170 mins).

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: Timeless romance that gave us an Oscar-winning Audrey Hepburn as the Italian princess who falls for hardbitten Yankee reporter Gregory Peck. (1953)(120 mins).

programme.title: The Cinema List: Super 70's
programme.desc: From Mad Max to Jaws, the 1970s saw some truly iconic movies storm onto screens. Take a look at some of our favourite 70s blockbusters here.

programme.title: Heaven Can Wait (1978)
programme.desc: Comedy starring Warren Beatty as a famous sportsman who, after his untimely death, attempts to find a new body to host his spirit. With Julie Christie. (1978)(96 mins).

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: Patrick Swayze stars as a murdered banker whose ghost walks the Earth to protect girlfriend Demi Moore. Romance with Whoopi Goldberg. Contains strong language/sex/violence. (1990)(129 mins).

programme.title: E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's hugely successful sci-fi drama about a young boy who makes friends with a stranded alien. With Drew Barrymore and Henry Thomas. Contains flashing images. (1982)(115 mins).

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: Quentin Tarantino's Oscar-winning western stars Jamie Foxx as a freed slave on a quest to find his wife. Christoph Waltz, Kerry Washington and Leonardo DiCaprio also star. (2012)(166 mins).

programme.title: Barbarella
programme.desc: Slinky space agent Jane Fonda sets out to stop mad scientist Durand Durand from destroying the galaxy. Sci-fi fantasy. Contains nudity and sexual references. (1967)(100 mins).

programme.title: The Dam Busters
programme.desc: Classic WWII epic about an engineer's daring plan to use bouncing bombs and low-flying aircraft to destroy a series of German dams. Richard Todd and Michael Redgrave star. (1955)(124 mins).

programme.desc: WWII comedy combining humour from director Billy Wilder with a superb performance by William Holden as a POW suspected of being an informer. Mild language/violence. (1953)(116 mins).

programme.desc: During the final weeks of the most consequential presidential election campaign in US history, America is poised to elect either its first female president or finally break the country's two-party gridlock with its first viable independent candidate. programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Jan 2024
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: The Machine
programme.desc: Bert, a stand-up comedian known as 'The Machine', is targeted by the Russian mob when his hard-partying past catches up with him 20 years down the road. Bert and his father are kidnapped to atone for those he wronged, and together they must re-trace the steps of his younger self while attempting to find common ground in their often fraught relationship. programme.desc: In 1627, gifted swordsman D'Artagnan heads to Paris with a letter of recommendation addressed to Captain De Treville, commander of the Musketeers. programme.title: Allelujah
programme.desc: A community hospital in Yorkshire affectionately known as the Beth is threatened with closure. programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Jan 2024
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: The Machine
programme.desc: Bert, a stand-up comedian known as 'The Machine', is targeted by the Russian mob when his hard-partying past catches up with him 20 years down the road. Bert and his father are kidnapped to atone for those he wronged, and together they must re-trace the steps of his younger self while attempting to find common ground in their often fraught relationship. programme.desc: Prince Amleth, the son of the murdered Viking King Aurvandill War-Raven, heads to cold, windswept Iceland to retrieve what was stolen from him - a father, a mother, and a kingdom. Amleth embarks on a murderous quest to find the hateful adversary, whose life is for ever woven together with his by the hands of fate. programme.title: Gunpowder Milkshake
programme.desc: In her turbulent life as a professional assassin, Scarlet was cruelly forced to abandon her daughter Sam and go on the run. Years later, despite the estrangement, Sam has also grown up into a cold-blooded hitwoman. After a high-stakes mission spins out of control, Sam has no choice but to go rogue. This ultimately leads her back to her mother and her former sidekicks, who join forces against those who took everything from them. programme.title: The Accidental Spy
programme.sub-title: Thriller, Drama, Action, Comedy, Crime/detective, Mystery ║ 2001 ║ 12
programme.desc: Martial arts thriller, starring Jackie Chan as a salesman at a exercise equipment store, who has dreams of living a more adventurous life. His wish starts to come true when he follows two suspicious-looking men into an alley and jumps into action when he realises they are robbing a jewellery shop. The resulting publicity from his heroic act brings him to the attention of a private investigator, who convinces him that he is the long-lost son of a rich Korean businessman. programme.title: F1 Highlights
programme.desc: At the 2023 Azerbaijan Grand Prix, the Sprint Shootout makes its debut in Baku - an all-new qualifying format that will set the grid for the afternoon's shortened 100km F1 Sprint.

programme.title: F1 Highlights
programme.desc: For the first time in 2023, it's time to Sprint as the Azerbaijan Grand Prix sees the first of six F1 Sprints. In a 100km dash, the drivers race all the way to the chequered flag.

programme.title: Ted's Notebook
programme.desc: Ted Kravitz brings his Notebook to the 2023 Azerbaijan Grand Prix - the venue for the first Sprint of the 2023 calendar - as he looks back on the race and shares his thoughts.

programme.title: F1 Highlights
programme.desc: After the glitz and glamour of Monaco last weekend, Formula 1 heads to another historic track, Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya, for the Spanish Grand Prix. Lee McKenzie, David Coulthard, Mark Webber, Billy Monger and Ariana Bravo present the highlights of the Qualifying session. Last year Charles Leclerc took pole position after his dramatic early spin in Q3. Can he take a consecutive pole in Barcelona? Or will the speed of the Red Bull cars lock out the front row?
